choices.E: Click Funnel icon, click AND, Select Resolved, is Not, State, click Run
choices.C: On the list of records, locate and right-click on the Resolved value, select Filter Out
choices.B: On State column title, right-click, select Filter Out > Resolved
choices.D: On the list of records, locate and right-click on the Resolved value, select Exclude
choices.A: On Search, select State, type not Resolved, press enter

Selected Answer: C
I have tested on PDI, for me answer C and E works well, BUT the order of answer is not correct in my point of view. If it would be E, the order should be 'Click Funnel icon, enter State (in Field), is not, (select) Resolved, click Run'. 

It is annoying that questions and answers sometimes are not written precisely. For this question I would choose C.

Selected Answer: A
ChatGPT - Connect Chat is a real-time messaging tool that enables users to chat with individuals and groups, quickly share files, and collaborate on any record by connecting with the right people instantly. It is not supported in Next Experience1. Agent Chat is the newer version of Connect Chat in ServiceNow. One of the first differences you’ll notice is that Agent Chat is not available in the standard ServiceNow user interface. Agents receive chats as well as other work items within Agent Workspace, which is a newer and more modern user interface (UI)2.

Selected Answer: A

Selected Answer: A
From the ServiceNow website: Connect Chat is a real-time messaging tool that enables users to chat with individuals and groups, quickly share files, and collaborate on any record by connecting with the right people instantly.
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-servicenow-platform/page/use/collaboration/concept/c_Collaboration.html

Also asked chatgpt:
Connect Chat is a real-time communication tool in the Tokyo release of ServiceNow, which was released in 2018. It is a feature of ServiceNow's collaboration module, which is designed to improve communication and collaboration between users within the platform.
User Presence:
The user presence feature in Tokyo release is integrated with the Connect Chat tool, allowing users to see the status of their colleagues directly in the chat interface. When a user is available, their presence status is indicated with a green dot next to their name. When they are busy, the dot is orange, and when they are away, the dot is gray.

This example demonstrates how to implement the following controls.
 Make a Close Notes field mandatory.
 Hide the Opened by field.
 Make the Priority, Severity, and Urgency fields read-only.
 Run a client script that displays an alert message.

A, B, D
Under the Advance, Run Scripts, you should be able to disable the save button when the data is not in the expected format or the number of characters is not equal to "n".

comments.content: this is the function of Data policy not UI policy, Data policy accept the data in an expected format, while the option B, this is usually enforced through Dictionary Attributes or Validation Scripts. UI policy primarily used to control the visibility, read- only and mandatory status of fields

discussion.content: CDE is correct - Page 434 of the ServiceNow Administration Fundamentals - Tokyo Edition.
